reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the best boutique hotels I've stayed in! It's great value for what you get.
reviews.title: Excellent value, extremely comfortable bed, cute decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Rooms:
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The rooms are rather small compared to your typical US hotel rooms, but I guess typical of Japanese hotel rooms. They make very good use of the available space though.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel but not a lot of space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: - The decor is really cutesy-trendy, done in a tasteful manner
reviews.title: Unique and comfortable boutique feeling hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Beds and pillows are EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE. We have slept in many 5 star hotel beds and this was just top notch. I don't know what it was about the bed and pillows, it was perfect. I'm quite picky about my bed/pillows and don't always sleep well when I'm not in my own bed. But I slept like a baby here, woke up feeling fresh with not an ache in my body (despite jet lag). I seriously felt like taking the pillows home with me!!!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel in an Amazing City!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel at the end of March for five days during the busy cherry blossom season. What a great hotel, great location and great price!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in Kyoto

likes.liked: — Location, close to restaurants and shopping as well as Gion district
likes.disliked: — On site restaurants were too expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They gave great restaurant recommendations, some of which ended up having english menus (our favourite was Za-Watami) and all the staff spoke excellent english.
reviews.title: New and lovely hotel in Kyoto

likes.disliked: — room size was acceptable but still small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights during a ten day trip around Japan. This hotel was our favorite! It has a sleek boutique hotel feel, with blue lights along the front desk and a modern crystal chandelier above the concierge area. The room was small, but all rooms in Japan are small, especially when you are looking for a good deal. The room was extremely clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Boutique hotel with a nice mix of old and new details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took advantage of the spa and public bath area on the top floor. The public bath (for a one time visit entry price is about $15) has 4-5 different baths, with one outdoor spa. When I went, I was the only one in the bath area, so I had my pick of the outdoor one, the large mineral bath, the hot tub, and the sauna. The acupressure massage was amazing and I highly recommend it for anyone traveling with heavy bags and walking a lot. It totally re-energized me for the rest of the trip.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as location is concerned, this hotel is within walking distance to Nijo Castle (probably the highlight of Kyoto for us) and is on one of the main subway lines. There is a Starbucks 1 block away and the nearest subway entrance is probably 2 blocks away. We walked to the Gion neighborhood and Pontocho avenue; but this was probably about a 20 minute walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location and good sized room
Great location, comfortable beds, worried about fire safety
reviews.text: Overall, I thought this hotel was beautiful and a great deal considering its location and amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Monterey is first class all the way. The lobby and library are sights in themselves, with the lobby's centerpiece a beautiful chandelier.
reviews.title: Small But Good Enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All previous reviews are spot on and I chose this hotel on that basis. Location was excellent a few minutes from the subway, 5 minutes from the main shopping area and quite close to main tourist sights. Rooms small and breakfast expensive but there are plenty of cafes including 2 Starbucks just a stone throw away. No wi fi unfortunately but a cable to plug your lap top into - unfortunately we dont travel with a lap top. I wasnt going to write a review as I felt all other reviewers have said it all but felt I needed to pass on my experience. We were woken by the fire alarm at 2 O Clock in the morning with a voice saying there is a fire on the 8th floor please evacuate. It was a farce, all fire doors were looked - people half asleep panicked dragging their suitcases to the lift where there was a large queue of people trying to get out. When we got to the ground floor there was no assistance and the bemused night staff who didnt speak English and didnt appear bothered in the least - I assume they were not aware the alarm had gone off. As guests mingled in the lobby most of us decided it was a false alarm and went back up in the lifts. It was quite worrying as there was no advice and for all we know we might have been going back up in the lift to a fire. Later on we heard a fire engine in the background and voices in the corridor - assume it was the fire men checking out the building. I pointed out the fire door which didnt open - I hope they made a note. At least their arrival reassured me!
reviews.title: Good position - nice service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must say before this I had never even considered safety issues at hotels and always looked at the convenience angle - maybe now I will consider safety too!
reviews.title: Sophisticated but small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here recently and loved it. It's in a modern part of Kyoto, but close to all the shopping, a number of museums, the subway and within walking distance (if you like to walk like we do!) of Gion. The rooms were great - small (although it's Japan - so to be expected), but clean and neat and perfect for what we wanted. Nice bathroom, too - not too small and felt very new. They also offered free internet access in the room, which we didn't find anywhere else in Japan (we brought a laptop and typically had to pay). We also got one night free - some sort of package they had, which made it even more affordable. The people at the desk were very helpful and spoke decent English, which was a plus. If you want to stay in a Western style hotel in Kyoto, this is a great choice!!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: An appealing hotel, nice looking and in good shape. I had a "superior double" room to myself, and I don't know how two people would manage--it was very, very small. The bed was nice though, so was the bathroom, nothing really to complain about, still I'm slightly disappointed. Given the very rave reviews, I had expected something more atmospheric and interesting, which is actually exactly how I feel about Kyoto as a city too. So, a good hotel, but not one I'll remember for very long.
reviews.title: decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is a few minutes walk away from the Kyoto metro station which makes it very convenient to visit anywhere in Kyoto. Hotel was nicely decorated with a modern touch and impeccably clean. Room was slightly smallish, but you wouldn't expect larger in the middle of the city. However it was very comfortable and well serviced.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean, nice decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hotel Monterey Kyoto
reviews.title: Good value, new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 3 Jyo Minami Karasuma-dori Nakagyo-ku
reviews.title: Good hotel but location could be better

likes.liked: — New facilities and well furnished rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Kyoto, Kyoto-fu 604-8161
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a real taste of luxury; superb beds and a very chic room. Hotel services were thorough and, as usual in this wonderful country, very polite. Very close to the metro and within walking distance to all sites, it was a very good choice. Unfortunately, I did find the options a bit expensive: Breakfast cost 27€, the use of the hotel baths 17€ and even the internet wasn't free. The mini bar was rather pricey too. Still, I suppose this is the price one pays when staying in such a high quality hotel (I normaly settle for the more budget range of hotels). A wise choice in a wonderful city.
reviews.title: Splendid hotel, splendid location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very efficient and well run hotel. The staff were discreet but always there and very happy to help. Good level of english spoken by all staff we met. We stayed in a superior double and were very pleased we upgraded as the size, although still small, was comfortable for the two of us and our two suitcases. Very clean and crisp rooms, the bathroom was absolutely spotless and nicely laid out. Very comfortable bed and pillows.
reviews.title: Perfect location, stress free stay, great location for exploring Kyoto on foot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed the Monterey. It was centrally located in Kyoto about a 10 minute walk from the metro stop and close to main bus stops.
reviews.title: Nice, clean rooms w/attentive service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: The desk staff spoke decent english and the concierge was always able to provide information about events and things to do and see.
reviews.title: A little Vegas, a little Disneyland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked 2 rooms at the Hotel Monterey through Expedia. I paid $140 per room per night. Given how expensive things are in Japan, I thought it was a good value. But before I go any further, in the spirit of full disclosure I have to tell you about the decor. One of the TA reviewers described it as "gothic" but I'd call it more Disney Haunted House meets Vegas wedding chapel. This hotel serves as a "church" many times per week for weddings complete with a fake movie set-like sanctuary, alter, pews, etc.. The fake "church" is not hidden off on the third floor somewhere, no it is the first thing you see when you walk into the hotel. The rest of the main floor is black marble with recessed art and sculpture, and chandeliers that look just like Vegas to complete the "castle" look. But heck, for the price I was willing to overlook the decor. The positives about this hotel are many. The staff are extremely helpful and speak a reasonable amount of English (much better than my Japanese). The hotel is brand new and the furnishings are perfect. The beds are firm and comfortable and the linens are pristine. The bathrooms are perfect, new with all the gadgets. The rooms are small but adequate and the strange decor seems to stop at the first floor. The location is really convenient. From the Kyoto Station take the Karasuma line north 3 stops to the Karasume Oike station. Exit the South exit. Walk south, past the bookstore, past the Starbucks, and another 1/2 block and you are at the hotel. I had wanted to stay at the Hotel Granvia at the Kyoto station but found it too expensive. But in retrospect, the Monterey is a much better location. We spent the Spring Break week in Kyoto. We never ate at the hotel but grabbed breakfast at the blessedly convenient Starbucks every morning. If you are there for more than 4 days, one suggestion I have is a day trip to Hiroshima. Easy with a JR pass. We took the 7:33 train, spent several hours on Miyajima. Then about 3 pm headed for the Hiroshima Museum which is very moving. Took a stroll through the Peace Park, had a nice dinner and took the 7:50 pm train back to Kyoto. My summary, for the price I paid. the Monterey was a good value.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay at the Monterey. It was very clean, VERY quiet, close to the subway stop, but the rooms were a bit small. The staff was very helpful - even gave us umbrellas on a rainy day! The hotel restaurant seemed rather pricey, but there are plenty of work arounds. There is a Starbucks, Tully's and another coffee place within easy walking distance, and a great place for dinner almost right across the street.
reviews.title: Wow, the staff and ammenities are amazing! Very nice Place.

likes.liked: — Staff, ammenities, breakfast buffet, central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: Stayed here week of January 20, 2008 for 3-nights. Absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms were amazing, well furnished, and decorated very nice. I stayed in a superior single by myself, which had double bed, buckwheat pillows, down comforter, flat screen, heated bathroom mirror, you name it. The room had everything. It is a very fancy boutique hotel. The rooms are not huge, but after looking and living in it, I know the room would still fit two comfortably. My mother stayed in a superior single too and she was very pleased with the room (and she travels quite extensively). The staff at this hotel is very impressive, and they work extremely hard to make your stay a memorable one. Every time I turned around, they had open arms trying to assist us. The concierge provided lots of maps, and great directions. They even recommended nice out of the way restaurants that had low prices and fabulous food. They constantly bow and say hello and goodbye in Japanese. The concierge and front desk spoke very good English, so there’s no need to worry about communication. The hotel is located directly in the center of town. We chose this location because it is equal distance to everything, and we didn’t want to be around tourists. While staying here we did notice a lot of Japanese tourists utilizing the hotel, as well as a national sports team. I’m glad we chose this spot because it was close to the subway, banks, Kinko’s copies for some business needs we had, and several restaurants and stores catering to the local Kyoto population. The morning breakfast buffet is huge!!!! You get your choice of Japanese or Western. I mixed it, and could not stop eating it was so good. The best way to start the day sightseeing began at that buffet! I can’t say enough about it.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for Kyoto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room size is about average (small) by my comparison with others in Japan, yet it is quite comfortable, clean and the bathroom was good.
reviews.title: Cute boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room air-conditioner was a little noisy, however this did not bother me as much as the noise from the hallway each morning from others, which woke me each morning.
reviews.title: Monterey a great, elegant choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet speed was good (cable).
reviews.title: Dissappointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel with spacious room. Got a great rate through Expedia (I used lots of reservation sites for this trip). Excellent location. No free computers or coffee, but every hotel we stayed at let you make tea in the room. Lovely.
reviews.title: Quality hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel between Christmas and a New Year in 2008 for three nights. We booked the hotel through yahoo. co.jp. The operator was jalan. Luckily for us I printed out the copy of the e-mail confirmation letter. We arrived at lunch time, too early for check-in, so we decided to have a lunch in a French restaurant. The staff in the hotel reception area asked if we had a reservation for a lunch. We told her that we had just arrived and were waiting for check-in, of course we didn't have any reservation in a restaurant. She took us to a restaurant, there were only two customers except us. What was the point of her question about reservation I had no idea. The French restaurant was actually very good, nice taste and service, with much more reasonable prices than in Tokyo. I recommend that restaurant. After lunch we came back to the hotel lobby to check-in. The process was too long. Finally we went to our room. The moment the elevator opened, the smell of tobacco was sooooo...... When we entered the room, the smell of smoke was unbearable. I asked what it means and she said it is a smoking floor. Rooms are very small, even double. So, all smoke is living there forever. I said we didn't book the smoking room. We came back to the lobby and for 40 minutes we had to explain that we didn't book that smoker's shelter. I showed the confirmation e-mail letter in Japanese and told her there is no kanji "smoking". She went to the office and printed out a jalan webpage where our plan is listed as smoking. I told her that that is not our plan, our plan has a different price, not the one that we paid and we booked through yahoo page, not jalan, with no kanji "smoking". Finally I asked to invite the manager. The guy didn't greet us and didn't talk to us. Finally they changed our room into non-smoking but the impression of that hotel was completely yukkie.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but I'm left wanting more...
